page.title: 08NEWHAVEN'S POLITICAL OUTLOOK
page.content:
Newhaven has been represented by the Conservatives since 1864, one of 3 wards making up Lewes constituency. The present M.P. is Mr. J. Rathbone. He represents the Conservative party. In the 1983 election he stood against people from Liberal, Labour and Ecology parties. His majority was 13,904.
He is 50 years old and was first elected M.P. for Lewes in 1974. During the last Parliament he was Parliamentary Private Secretary to the Minister of Health 1979-81 and to the Minister of Consumer Affairs 1982. In the 1985 County Council election, a Conservative, Colonel Harwood, won the seat against strong Socialist opposition from Mrs. Lamont.
